p: Serum levels of AST and ALT were considerably higher in the CCl 4-treated group as compared to the control group (proves the hepatotoxic effect of CCl 4) and were significantly lowered in the extract-pretreated group as compared to the CCl 4-treated group (indicates the hepatoprotective effect of T. scandens leaves in the prevention of hepatotoxin-induced acute liver injury). Similarly, levels of the biomarkers that denote lipid peroxidation and protein oxidation were much higher in the CCl 4-treated group than in the control group. Furthermore, pretreatment with T. scandens ethanol extract had significantly reduced their levels in the extract-treated group. On the contrary, activities of the antioxidant enzymes were significantly reduced in the CCl 4-treated group but were of normal levels for the extract pretreated animals. These findings proved that T. scandens extract has a significant protective effect against CCl 4-induced hepatotoxicity in rats, which may be due to its antioxidant properties.[ 14]
